definition: to speak/to say/to explain/to scold/to tell off/a theory (typically the last character in a compound, as in 日心說|日心说 heliocentric theory)

sentences.english: But the news for romance novel fans isn't entirely heart-breaking.
sentences.chinese: 然而這樣的新聞並不能完全喚醒言情小說的粉絲。

sentences.english: From a practical perspective, romantic fiction has an unhealthy tendency to gloss over contraception.
sentences.chinese: 從實際來看，言情小說有粉飾避孕的不健康導向。

sentences.english: My heart thudded, every romantic novel I had read was true.
sentences.chinese: 原來我所讀的每一本言情小說都是真的。

sentences.english: I read everything I can get my hands on but I like love stories best.
sentences.chinese: 我拿到什麼書看什麼書，但最喜歡看言情小說。

sentences.english: Romance still made a showing, but the list was dominated by crime novels.
sentences.chinese: 言情小說仍有讀者羣，但犯罪小說已處於領先地位。

sentences.english: Romantic fiction written by Qiongyao influence many people.
sentences.chinese: 瓊瑤的言情小說影響了好多人。

definition: Pride and prejudice, novel by Jane Austen 珍·奧斯汀|珍·奥斯汀
to overdose on supplementary medicine/to cram too hard
to mix/to blend/(fig.) to spoil/to mess up things/to run around with (sb)/to get involved with/to mix (with other people)
to invent crazy nonsense/to cook up (excuses)/to talk at random/wild babble
rice tub (from which cooked rice or other food is served)/(fig.) fathead/a good-for-nothing
